message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SE

This paper is primarily focused on the security and networking aspects of a new generation hybrid botnet that covertly communicates over Bitcoin Lightning Network (LN). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Additionally, the paper also discusses the scalability and performance of the proposed approach, which makes cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) another likely sub-category. The paper also involves the design and implementation of a two-layer botnet, which can be categorized under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper also discusses the implementation of a proof-of-concept on the actual Bitcoin network, which can be categorized under cs.SE (Software Engineering).
